roleset.name: worry with direct object

roles.note: Use this sense when the worrier is the direct object of an active construction, or the subject of a passive construction.

example.name: straight transitive
example.text: Mr. Rowe also noted that political concerns also worried New England Electric.

example.name: all args
example.text: John worried his mother with his habit of talking to strangers.
example.arg: with his habit of talking to strangers

example.name: Passive with trace (when treebank decides to do it this way)
example.text: [the agency]-1 is worried *trace*-1 that a sharp market drop could create capital problems for the firms .
example.arg: that a sharp market drop could create capital problems for the firms.

example.name: adjectival rel: worrying; empty it
example.text: It 's worrying that some people need more clarification past " vampires do n't exist " .
example.arg: that some people need more clarification past " vampires don't exist"

roleset.note: Frames file for 'worry' based on financial subcorpus; adjectival 'worrying' based on BOLT-4,5; adjectival 'worrisome' based on medi-seedcorpus.

example.name: adjectival rel: worrisome
example.text: This is very worrisome for perigraft abscess formation .

roles.note: Use this sense when the worrier is the subject of an active construction.

example.name: worry about
example.text: John's mother worries constantly about her baby.

example.name: worry that
example.text: Some economists and government officials seriously worried that it might collapse , producing panic among foreign investors and diminishing the flow of foreign capital to the U.S.
example.arg: that it might collapse, producing panic among foreign investors and diminishing the flow of foreign capital to the U.S.
